org.cloudifysource.dsl
Class ServiceLifecycle

java.lang.Object
  org.cloudifysource.dsl.ServiceLifecycle
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ServiceLifecycle
extends Object
implements Serializable

Domain POJO of the service lifecycle, part of the Service Recipe declaration. Non-null Elements in the lifecycle POJO indicate actions that should be executed when the service reaches a certain lifecycle phase. Executable entries can take one of several forms:
1. String - indicates a command line to execute (command lines may be modified according to USM rules) 2. Closure - code that executes in-process 3. Map - Where keys are Java regular expressions and values are command lines (as in 1). The entry to be executed is the first one where the key regex matches the operating system name of the host running the service. Common keys include 'Win.*', 'Linux.*', etc. See the documentation for examples.

Since:
2.0.0
Author:
barakme.
See Also:
